hedline.hl1: Don't Like Today's Candidates? Step Back in Time

abstract.p: American Museum of Moving Image presents online compilation of television campaign ads for presidential elections since 1952; photo (S)

block.p: A new Web feature lets you compare TV commercials and pick a candidate: Ike or Adlai. The Living Room Candidate, an online version of a 1992 exhibition at the American Museum of the Moving Image (ammi.org), has compiled television campaign ads for presidential elections from 1952 to the present. The highlights include campy cartoons from the 1952 Eisenhower-Stevenson race and infamous attack ads from the campaigns of Lyndon B. Johnson (the ad that showed a little girl picking the petals of a daisy -- until a nuclear bomb exploded) and George Bush (the Willie Horton ad). The Desktop Candidate area links to sites with TV ads from the 2000 race and archives with the 1996 campaigns' online efforts. Carl Goodman, the museum's curator of digital media, said visitors could examine ''parallels between how politicians started to use the then-new medium of television and the kind of baby steps that are being taken now on the Internet.''
MATTHEW MIRAPAUL

Events

SUNDAY, 6 p.m. www.cadillac.com/news/swimming.htm A virtual 100-meter swimming race pits five past Olympic medal winners -- Johnny Weissmuller, Buster Crabbe, Don Schollander, Mark Spitz and Matt Biondi -- against one another, after accounting for contemporary fitness and training techniques.
SUNDAY, 9 p.m. www.eyada.com Chat with Farrah Fawcett about her roles in ''Dr T. and the Women,'' a film by Robert Altman, and a remake of ''Charlie's Angels,'' her television series from the 1970's.
MONDAY, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. www.girlgeeks.com or www.techiesday.org Webcast of a symposium on the future of jobs in technology.
TUESDAY, 7 p.m. www.bn.com Chat with Joe Cocker about his new album, ''No Ordinary World.''
Sites
www.cityworm.com A New York artist's plan to turn garbage into gardener's gold: Naomi Dagan Bloom suggests a bin of red wriggler worms in every kitchen to make compost.

www.batcon.org The Web site of Bat Conservation International has information about rabies and bats, samples of bat calls and bat facts -- did you know that the largest bat living in the United States is the Western mastiff, which weighs two ounces and has a wing span of almost two feet?

baseball-almanac.com There have been more than 350 pairs of brothers in professional baseball, from Hank and Tommie Aaron to Jeff and Jordan Zimmerman. Lists, statistics, and trivia about songs and movies can be found on this site.
